intro: Borreria cataractarum, commonly known as the waterburr, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found near water bodies. Borreria cataractarum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
